segments.text: I can’t believe how much water is pouring out of that sink, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying a plate like it’s a normal day.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor is already soaked, and the puddle is getting bigger by the second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the drain is clogged or if she just forgot to turn off the faucet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so sneaky, and she has no idea what’s going on behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is about to fall, and the girl is just standing there, waiting for a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the stool doesn’t tip over—he could really hurt himself.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just so chaotic, and yet everyone seems so calm.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t understand how she hasn’t noticed any of this yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I need to step in and fix this before it gets worse.
segments.speaker: PAR
